image_uri.description: URI (usually S3 URL) of the image storage location. This field is mandatory and must contain a valid URI to the stored image, typically received from an external upload system such as S3 via the Spring backend.

oneOf.description: Optional alt text or description for accessibility or search applications. Including a description can improve searchability, accessibility for users using screen readers, and image context display. This field can be omitted if not required.

description.description: Optional alt text or description for accessibility or search applications. Including a description can improve searchability, accessibility for users using screen readers, and image context display. This field can be omitted if not required.

oneOf.description: Optional reference to the specific story page this image is tied to. If provided, must relate to an existing story page. Allows for associating images directly with a page (e.g., page illustration), or omitting to associate at the story level.

storyfield_ai_story_page_id.description: Optional reference to the specific story page this image is tied to. If provided, must relate to an existing story page. Allows for associating images directly with a page (e.g., page illustration), or omitting to associate at the story level.

IStoryfieldAiStoryImage.ICreate.description:
Request body for creating a new story image record. This input enables linking an uploaded image to a StoryField AI tale (and optionally to a specific page), providing a URI (usually from S3), with optional description for context or accessibility.

Follows business rules outlined in the Prisma schema, with compliance on audit fields and logical relationships. Does not store the image file, only metadata for locating and describing it.

image_uri.description: Updated URI (S3 URL) of the image. If an image is replaced (e.g., re-uploaded), this field should be set with the new URI. May be omitted if no change is desired.

oneOf.description: Optional update for the alt text or description of the image. Used for accessibility, search, or content review. If set to null, removes existing description.

description.description: Optional update for the alt text or description of the image. Used for accessibility, search, or content review. If set to null, removes existing description.

oneOf.description: Optional new association to a specific page. Allows moving the image to another page or removing the page association by setting null.

storyfield_ai_story_page_id.description: Optional new association to a specific page. Allows moving the image to another page or removing the page association by setting null.

IStoryfieldAiStoryImage.IUpdate.description:
Payload for updating an existing story image record. Permits partial modification of URI, alt description, or associated story page ref. Used for image corrections, accessibility improvements, or re-association.

Only fields to be changed need to be included. Adheres to audit and logical constraints defined in the Prisma schema.

page.description: Optional page of paginated TTS results (starting at 1). Used to control which slice of results to return. If omitted, defaults to first page.

limit.description: Maximum number of results per page. Used for pagination. If omitted, the service default is used.

dialect.description: Optional filter to restrict results to a particular dialect (e.g., 'standard', 'gyeongsang', 'jeolla'). If present, only TTS results matching this dialect are returned.

storyfield_ai_story_page_id.description: Optional ID filter to fetch TTS results associated with a specific story page (as opposed to the whole story). If set, limits results to only that page.

orderBy.description: Field name to use for result sorting (e.g., 'created_at', 'dialect'). Determines result ordering direction when paired with orderDirection. Optional.

oneOf.description: Direction for result sorting: ascending ('asc') or descending ('desc'). If included, must match one of the enumerated values.
Direction for result sorting: ascending ('asc') or descending ('desc'). If included, must match one of the enumerated values.

orderDirection.description: Direction for result sorting: ascending ('asc') or descending ('desc'). If included, must match one of the enumerated values.

created_after.description: Optional filter for results created after a specific datetime (ISO 8601).

created_before.description: Optional filter for results created before a specific datetime (ISO 8601).

onlyActive.description: If true, limits results to only those not soft-deleted (deleted_at is null). Useful for filtering out logically deleted records.

IStoryfieldAiTtsResult.IRequest.description: Request payload for searching and paginating TTS results for a specific story. Allows filtering by dialect, story page, time range, and ordering.

id.description: Primary key, UUID of the TTS result.

storyfield_ai_story_id.description: ID of the parent story for which this TTS result was generated.

oneOf.description: ID of the story page if this TTS result is for a specific page. Nullable: set to null if result is for the full story.

storyfield_ai_story_page_id.description: ID of the story page if this TTS result is for a specific page. Nullable: set to null if result is for the full story.

tts_audio_uri.description: URI (typically a presigned S3 URL) to the generated audio file for TTS playback. This is the main output artifact.

source_text.description: The input text string from which TTS speech was generated. May be page text or full story text, preserved for audit and accessibility.

dialect.description: The dialect or language parameter used in generating this TTS result (e.g., 'standard', 'gyeongsang', 'jeolla'). Ensures alignment with language accessibility and region-specific requirements.

created_at.description: Datetime (ISO 8601) when the TTS result was created. Used for audit, sort, and record-keeping.

updated_at.description: Datetime (ISO 8601) for last update to this TTS result, for tracking modification lifecycle.

oneOf.description: Soft deletion timestamp. Null if active; if set, record is considered deleted (logically invisible except for audit/recovery).

deleted_at.description: Soft deletion timestamp. Null if active; if set, record is considered deleted (logically invisible except for audit/recovery).

IStoryfieldAiTtsResult.description:
Represents a TTS (text-to-speech) result record produced for a story or story page. Includes reference IDs, source text, dialect, S3 or external audio URI, and full audit lifecycle fields as defined in the Prisma schema.

Used in TTS result queries, playback, and compliance reporting contexts.

storyfield_ai_story_id.description: References the parent story (storyfield_ai_stories.id) to which the TTS result belongs. This is a required field and must match an existing story. Used as the foreign key for story-ownership.

oneOf.description: Optionally references the specific page of the story (storyfield_ai_story_pages.id) if the TTS result is for a specific page. Nullable for whole-story TTS results.

storyfield_ai_story_page_id.description: Optionally references the specific page of the story (storyfield_ai_story_pages.id) if the TTS result is for a specific page. Nullable for whole-story TTS results.

tts_audio_uri.description: The URI (typically a pre-signed S3 URL) of the generated TTS audio file. Must be a valid and accessible link for playback or download.

source_text.description: The text input used for TTS synthesis. This is the sentence, page, or story content from which the TTS output is generated.

dialect.description: Specifies the dialect or language variant used in TTS synthesis (e.g., 'standard', 'gyeongsang', 'jeolla'). Must be consistent with supported dialects/values in the business logic.

IStoryfieldAiTtsResult.ICreate.description: Data required for creating a new Text-to-Speech (TTS) result record for a story or story page. Used when a client requests new TTS synthesis, it stores the relationship to the parent story, input text, output audio URI, and language/dialect information. Descriptions based on Prisma schema columns. Soft deletion is not tracked at creation.

tts_audio_uri.description: New or updated URI for the TTS audio file, if the TTS result has been regenerated or re-uploaded.

source_text.description: Updated text input for the TTS result, when correction or localization of source sentence is needed.

dialect.description: Update to the language or dialect for the TTS result. Must follow supported dialect enum/values in business logic.

oneOf.description: Optionally updates the reference to a different story page. If set to null, the TTS result is considered whole-story rather than page-specific.

storyfield_ai_story_page_id.description: Optionally updates the reference to a different story page. If set to null, the TTS result is considered whole-story rather than page-specific.

IStoryfieldAiTtsResult.IUpdate.description: DTO for updating mutable properties of an existing TTS result (storyfield_ai_tts_results). Supports updating URI, source text, dialect, or targeted page reference. All fields are optional for PATCH/PUT semantics.

authenticated_user_id.description: Search filter: Filter sessions belonging to a specific authenticated user.

system_admin_id.description: Search filter: Filter sessions created/owned by a specific system administrator.

fingerprint.description: Search filter: Filter sessions matching a specific device/browser fingerprint or client identifier.

issued_start.description: Search filter: Only return sessions issued on or after this datetime.

issued_end.description: Search filter: Only return sessions issued on or before this datetime.

expires_start.description: Search filter: Sessions expiring at or after this datetime.

expires_end.description: Search filter: Sessions expiring on or before this datetime.

last_activity_start.description: Search filter: Sessions whose last recorded activity was at or after this datetime.

last_activity_end.description: Search filter: Sessions whose last recorded activity was at or before this datetime.

oneOf.description: Search filter: Restrict to sessions matching current status (active/expires/deleted). Must match allowed enum.
Search filter: Restrict to sessions matching current status (active/expires/deleted). Must match allowed enum.
Search filter: Restrict to sessions matching current status (active/expires/deleted). Must match allowed enum.

status.description: Search filter: Restrict to sessions matching current status (active/expires/deleted). Must match allowed enum.

page.description: Pagination: Page number for paginated results.

limit.description: Pagination: Maximum number of results per page.

sort.description: Sort parameter for session results, e.g., 'issued_at', 'expires_at', 'last_activity_at'.

oneOf.description: Sort order: ascending ('asc') or descending ('desc').
Sort order: ascending ('asc') or descending ('desc').

IStoryfieldAiTokenSession.IRequest.description: Advanced search, filter, and pagination options for the authentication token/session registry in the Storyfield AI platform. Allows admin or users to query sessions by owner, device, issuance window, status, and more.

id.description: Primary key for the session record as stored in the database. Uniquely identifies the authentication session.

oneOf.description: References the authenticated user for this session if applicable.

authenticated_user_id.description: References the authenticated user for this session if applicable.

oneOf.description: References the system administrator associated with this session (if session is admin-based).

system_admin_id.description: References the system administrator associated with this session (if session is admin-based).

token_hash.description: The hash of the authentication token used in this session (never the raw token). Used to enforce session uniqueness and audit.

fingerprint.description: Device or browser fingerprint used to identify the client binding for session uniqueness and traceability.

issued_at.description: Timestamp when the session or token was initially issued. Required for session management and audit trails.

expires_at.description: Timestamp when the session is scheduled to expire. Used for session lifecycle and compliance.

oneOf.description: Datetime of most recent refresh event for this session if ever refreshed.

refreshed_at.description: Datetime of most recent refresh event for this session if ever refreshed.

last_activity_at.description: Timestamp of the last activity event recorded for this session (i.e., any API call or token usage event).

created_at.description: Creation timestamp of the session record itself (may match issued_at).

updated_at.description: Timestamp of the most recent update to the session record, for audit and revision tracking.

oneOf.description: Timestamp if the session has been soft-deleted or forcibly invalidated.

deleted_at.description: Timestamp if the session has been soft-deleted or forcibly invalidated.

IStoryfieldAiTokenSession.description: Represents a complete record in the authentication token/session registry (storyfield_ai_token_sessions). Includes references to owning user or admin, device fingerprint, creation/update timestamps, status, and all audit fields. Based directly on Prisma schema.

fingerprint.description: Device or browser fingerprint for session uniqueness and session tracking. Used to uniquely identify a device or browser context for authentication session management. Corresponds to 'fingerprint' in the Prisma model.

expires_at.description: Timestamp indicating when the authentication token will expire, in ISO 8601 format. Editable only for compliance or administrative actions, not by normal users. Schema: 'expires_at' (DateTime).

refreshed_at.description: Timestamp for the most recent refresh of this session (token refresh event), in ISO 8601 format. Optional and nullable. Schema: 'refreshed_at' (DateTime, nullable).

last_activity_at.description: Timestamp of the last activity associated with the session, used for session activity audit. Schema: 'last_activity_at' (DateTime).

deleted_at.description: Soft delete marker for deactivated/inactive/invalidated sessions. When present, the session is considered closed or revoked for compliance. Schema: 'deleted_at' (DateTime, nullable).

IStoryfieldAiTokenSession.IUpdate.description: Payload for updating attributes of an existing authentication token/session record. Enables patching session audit, compliance, or lifecycle fields such as device fingerprint, expiration, refresh activity, last usage, or logical removal (soft deletion). Based on the 'storyfield_ai_token_sessions' Prisma model.

authenticated_user_id.description: Filter results by authenticated user UUID associated with the token revocation event. Optional filter; corresponds to 'authenticated_user_id' in Prisma.

system_admin_id.description: Filter results by system admin UUID responsible for the revocation event. Optional filter; corresponds to 'system_admin_id' in Prisma.

revoked_reason.description: Filter results by the reason provided for the revocation (usually a substring match). Optional filter for administrative/forensic queries.

created_at_from.description: Start range for filtering revocations by creation time (ISO 8601). Used to select revocations made after this timestamp.

created_at_to.description: End range for filtering revocations by creation time (ISO 8601). Used to select revocations made before this timestamp.

page.description: Pagination: results page number (starts from 1 by convention).

limit.description: Pagination: number of records per page. Standard is 20-100.

oneOf.description: Sorting direction for results: ascending ('asc') or descending ('desc').
Sorting direction for results: ascending ('asc') or descending ('desc').

orderDir.description: Sorting direction for results: ascending ('asc') or descending ('desc').

IStoryfieldAiTokenRevocation.IRequest.description: Advanced filtering, sorting, and pagination parameters for searching token revocation audit records. Used in admin/security dashboards.

id.description: Unique identifier (UUID primary key) for the token revocation audit record as stored in 'storyfield_ai_token_revocations'. Used for direct lookup.

token_session_id.description: Reference to the associated authentication token session (UUID), if present. Nullable to support sessionless revocations as per business rules.

authenticated_user_id.description: Reference to the authenticated user's UUID (if the revocation pertains to a regular user). Nullable for admin- or script-level actions.

system_admin_id.description: Reference to the system admin actor's UUID (if the revocation was performed by an admin). Nullable for external or automated events.

token_hash.description: Hashed value of the revoked token. Plain tokens are never stored; only the securely hashed value is recorded for security and auditability. Represents 'token_hash' in the Prisma schema.

revoked_reason.description: Description or reason for why the token was revoked (e.g., 'compromise', 'logout', 'admin revocation'). Required field in Prisma.

revoked_by_ip.description: IP address from which the revocation was triggered. May be null if not available or when caused by programmatic/system action. Enables security forensics and compliance audits.

created_at.description: Timestamp (ISO 8601) representing the time when the revocation record was created. Used for audit and compliance tracking.

IStoryfieldAiTokenRevocation.description: Token revocation audit entry, representing a specific revoked authentication token by hash. Main fields are references to session/user/admin actors, hashed token value, revocation reason, origin IP address, and creation timestamp. Mirrors the 'storyfield_ai_token_revocations' Prisma model.

revoked_reason.description: Update the administrative or business reason for the revocation entry. Permitted for adjustment by administrators only. Optional per business process.

revoked_by_ip.description: Correction or logging of the IP address from which the revocation was performed. Nullable and optional as per field rules.

IStoryfieldAiTokenRevocation.IUpdate.description: Fields for partial administrative update of a token revocation record (e.g., correcting revocation reason or source IP address). Based on 'storyfield_ai_token_revocations' schema.

event_type.description: Filter for audit logs by the event type (e.g. 'issued', 'validated', 'revoked'). Matches the 'event_type' column in the authentication audit log table.

event_outcome.description: Filter audit logs by outcome (e.g. 'success', 'failure', 'partial'). Corresponds to the 'event_outcome' field in authentication audit entries.

authenticated_user_id.description: Optional filter for only audit logs associated with a particular authenticated user. Must be a valid UUID referencing the 'authenticated_user_id' column.

system_admin_id.description: Optional filter for only audit logs associated with a specific system administrator. UUID referencing the 'system_admin_id' column.

from_date.description: Lower bound (inclusive) for audit logs, based on the creation timestamp. ISO8601 date-time format.

to_date.description: Upper bound (inclusive) for audit logs, based on the creation timestamp. ISO8601 date-time format.

page.description: Pagination: page number to fetch. Used to retrieve results in multiple pages for large log sets.

limit.description: Pagination: number of results to return per page (default 100, maximum 200).

IStoryfieldAiAuthAuditLog.IRequest.description: Request parameters for searching and filtering authentication audit logs. Supports filtering by event type/outcome, associated user/admin, and time window, as well as pagination. Follows compliance, operational monitoring, and audit trail review requirements for authentication/authorization event history. See 'storyfield_ai_auth_audit_logs' in the Prisma schema for all available columns.

id.description: Unique identifier of the authentication audit log record. Primary key ('id' column) for referencing and auditing.

token_session_id.description: Optional ID referencing the related authentication token/session. Points to 'token_session_id' column if present, or null for sessionless events.

authenticated_user_id.description: Optional reference ID for the authenticated user associated with this log event. Corresponds to 'authenticated_user_id'.

system_admin_id.description: Optional reference ID for system administrator related to the event. Set for admin-auth or privileged events (see 'system_admin_id').

event_type.description: The type of audit event, such as 'issued', 'validated', 'revoked', 'expired'. Describes the nature of the event for compliance and forensics.

event_outcome.description: Result of the audit event (e.g. 'success', 'failure', 'partial'). Indicates whether authentication/authorization succeeded, failed, or was partial.

event_message.description: Optional human-readable message or diagnostic context for the event. Contains a string explanation or error context, or null if omitted.

source_ip.description: Optional source IP address from which the authentication event was performed. Useful for audit tracking and incident analysis. Can be null.

user_agent.description: Optional user-agent string or device signature tied to the event context. Used for session/device traceability.

created_at.description: ISO8601 timestamp when the audit event was created. Follows 'created_at' in the schema for event ordering and traceability.

IStoryfieldAiAuthAuditLog.description: Authentication audit/event log entry. Records all major authentication and authorization actions (token issuance, validation, failure, admin actions) for compliance, forensics, and abuse monitoring. Maps directly to 'storyfield_ai_auth_audit_logs' in the database schema. Optional fields connect to users, admins, session, or device information for traceability. Follows security/compliance documentation for audit trail completeness and supports fine-grained event investigation.

event_type.description: Type of integration event to match (e.g. 'API_CALL', 'RECOVERY'). Filters logs based on integration event type. Matches 'event_type' column.

subsystem.description: Name of the subsystem/component for integration event filter (e.g. 's3', 'openai', 'spring_backend'). Uses 'subsystem' column.

status.description: Integration event status value (e.g. 'SUCCESS', 'FAILURE', 'PARTIAL'). Used to select events with a particular outcome/status.

storyfield_ai_authenticateduser_id.description: Optional UUID reference filter for logs associated with a specific authenticated user. Matches 'storyfield_ai_authenticateduser_id'.

storyfield_ai_story_id.description: Optional UUID reference to select logs related to a specific story. Matches 'storyfield_ai_story_id'.

from_date.description: Lower date/time (inclusive) for filtering event logs, based on 'created_at'. ISO8601 format.

to_date.description: Upper date/time (inclusive) for filtering event logs, based on 'created_at'. ISO8601 format.

page.description: Page number for integration log search pagination.

limit.description: Page size for integration log search (default 100, max 200).

IStoryfieldAiIntegrationLog.IRequest.description: Request parameters for paginated, filtered search of cross-system integration logs. Supports powerful filtering by event type, subsystem, outcome, associated user/story, and time range (created_at), as well as pagination/sorting optimizations. Designed for operational audits, compliance review, root cause analysis, and technical troubleshooting use-cases. Maps to 'storyfield_ai_integration_logs' in the database schema.

id.description: Unique identifier of the integration log record. Primary key for event tracking, audit history, and troubleshooting.

storyfield_ai_authenticateduser_id.description: Optional reference to the authenticated user associated with this integration event. Null if not user-linked.

storyfield_ai_story_id.description: Optional reference to the story entity associated with this integration log. Null if not story-linked.

event_type.description: Type of integration event (e.g. 'API_CALL', 'RECOVERY', 'S3_UPLOAD'). Encodes the category of event logged.

subsystem.description: Subsystem/connector/component responsible for or involved in this integration event. Used for filtering and audit purposes.

status.description: Human-friendly description or code indicating the event status (e.g. 'SUCCESS', 'FAILURE', 'PARTIAL'). Typically matches a constrained set of values.

message.description: Detailed message, error, or diagnostic context for this integration event. Can contain technical error details, traces, or success/failure information.

request_id.description: Optional correlation/request trace ID, used in event tracing and distributed system correlation. Null if not provided.

created_at.description: Timestamp (ISO8601) when the integration event record was created. Supports audit, operational history, and temporal analysis.

updated_at.description: Timestamp (ISO8601) when the record was last updated. Enables revision tracking and audit analysis of log record mutations.

deleted_at.description: Soft deletion timestamp. If present, indicates the record is inactive or logically deleted per compliance requirements.

IStoryfieldAiIntegrationLog.description: Cross-system integration audit log record. Captures essential business/technical events for all significant cross-system actionsâ€”API calls, connectors, recovery events, and business triggers. Contains metadata linking to user/story context where relevant, event diagnostics, correlation IDs, and complete audit history. Designed for troubleshooting, operational monitoring, compliance, and forensic review in the StoryField AI platform. Structures map to 'storyfield_ai_integration_logs' table in database for full traceability.

oneOf.description: Optional reference to the authenticated user associated with this integration event. UUID of storyfield_ai_authenticatedusers.

storyfield_ai_authenticateduser_id.description: Optional reference to the authenticated user associated with this integration event. UUID of storyfield_ai_authenticatedusers.

oneOf.description: Optional reference to the story associated with this integration event. UUID of storyfield_ai_stories.

storyfield_ai_story_id.description: Optional reference to the story associated with this integration event. UUID of storyfield_ai_stories.

event_type.description: Type of integration event (e.g., API_CALL, CONNECTOR_TRIGGER, RECOVERY, S3_UPLOAD, ERROR, RETRY, etc.). Business event category for filtering and audit.

subsystem.description: Subsystem or third-party connector involved in this event (e.g., s3, spring_backend, openai, tts_engine, etc.).

status.description: Human-friendly description or status code of the integration event outcome (SUCCESS, FAILURE, PARTIAL, etc.).

oneOf.description: Detailed description/message or error context for this event. Can include error messages from external systems, stack traces, or summary information.

message.description: Detailed description/message or error context for this event. Can include error messages from external systems, stack traces, or summary information.

oneOf.description: Optional: Correlation ID or unique request trace for distributed event linking. Enables cross-system root cause tracing.

request_id.description: Optional: Correlation ID or unique request trace for distributed event linking. Enables cross-system root cause tracing.

IStoryfieldAiIntegrationLog.ICreate.description: Payload for creating a new integration log event. All required fields must be present. Optionally links to user/story for trace and audit. Used for operational monitoring and compliance.

event_type.description: Type of integration event (e.g., API_CALL, RECOVERY, etc.).

subsystem.description: Subsystem where the integration event happened.

status.description: Describes the outcome or high-level state (e.g., SUCCESS, FAILURE).

oneOf.description: New or archived error/context detail for the event.

message.description: New or archived error/context detail for the event.

oneOf.description: (Optional) Distributed request correlation ID, used for trace/debug.

request_id.description: (Optional) Distributed request correlation ID, used for trace/debug.

oneOf.description: If set, marks this record as logically deleted.

deleted_at.description: If set, marks this record as logically deleted.

IStoryfieldAiIntegrationLog.IUpdate.description: DTO for updating an existing integration log event entry. Allows partial business event info patchingâ€”see schema for field constraints.

oneOf.description: Optional: only show records for this user.

storyfield_ai_authenticateduser_id.description: Optional: only show records for this user.

oneOf.description: Optional: only show records for a particular story.

storyfield_ai_story_id.description: Optional: only show records for a particular story.

filename.description: Restrict or pattern match with filename field.

media_type.description: Restrict to resource type (story_image, tts_audio, asr_audio, etc.).

upload_status.description: Restrict to upload outcome (SUCCESS, FAILURE, etc.).

created_at_gte.description: Filter: only entries from this date/time onwards.

created_at_lte.description: Filter: only entries up to and including this date/time.

page.description: Page number for pagination. (1-based)

limit.description: Maximum number of items per page.

sort.description: Property and direction for sort (e.g., created_at:desc).

IStoryfieldAiS3UploadHistory.IRequest.description: Advanced search and pagination options for bulk S3 upload history log retrieval. Supports business-driven filtering by user, story, status, media_type, date, and sorting.

id.description: Primary key for S3 upload entry.

oneOf.description: Optional reference to the user who initiated the upload (UUID of storyfield_ai_authenticatedusers).

storyfield_ai_authenticateduser_id.description: Optional reference to the user who initiated the upload (UUID of storyfield_ai_authenticatedusers).

oneOf.description: Optional reference to the story associated to this upload (UUID of storyfield_ai_stories).

storyfield_ai_story_id.description: Optional reference to the story associated to this upload (UUID of storyfield_ai_stories).

filename.description: Name of the file being uploaded (original or system-generated filename).

file_size.description: File size in bytes when submitted for upload.

media_type.description: Media resource type (story_image, tts_audio, asr_audio, etc.).

upload_status.description: Result of upload attempt (SUCCESS, FAILURE, RETRY, PARTIAL, etc.).

oneOf.description: Descriptive error or diagnostic message if upload failed.

error_message.description: Descriptive error or diagnostic message if upload failed.

spring_upload_url.description: Spring backend upload endpoint used (full URI for traceability).

oneOf.description: Resulting S3 object URL provided by Spring, if upload obtained valid S3 URL.

s3_object_url.description: Resulting S3 object URL provided by Spring, if upload obtained valid S3 URL.

created_at.description: Timestamp of upload record creation.

updated_at.description: Timestamp of last update to upload record.

oneOf.description: Timestamp if the upload record was soft deleted. Null otherwise.

deleted_at.description: Timestamp if the upload record was soft deleted. Null otherwise.

IStoryfieldAiS3UploadHistory.description: Represents a single S3 upload history entry for backend file storage and compliance traceability. Integrates file info, upload status, audit, and business metadata.

storyfield_ai_authenticateduser_id.description: Optional reference to the user who initiated the media upload. Links to storyfield_ai_authenticatedusers.id. Null if not associated with a user.

storyfield_ai_story_id.description: Optional reference to the story associated with this upload. Links to storyfield_ai_stories.id. Null if not associated with a story.

filename.description: Name of the uploaded file, either original or system-generated. Used for identification, traceability, and duplicate prevention.

file_size.description: File size in bytes at the time of upload. Audited for policy compliance and quota/billing calculations.

media_type.description: The type of media resource being uploaded (e.g., story_image, tts_audio, asr_audio, etc.). Used for business logic filtering, SLA reporting, and compliance. Must match one of the supported media types documented in business requirements.

upload_status.description: Status of this upload operation, such as 'SUCCESS', 'FAILURE', 'RETRY', or 'PARTIAL'. Used for audit, diagnostics, and user feedback.

error_message.description: If upload failed, details the nature or external error message. Used for troubleshooting, audit, and SLA breach root-cause analysis. Often a response from the spring or S3 subsystem.

spring_upload_url.description: The endpoint (fully qualified URI) of the Spring backend used for the upload event. Used for operational auditing, business traceability, and compliance with source-of-origin policies.

s3_object_url.description: The resultant S3 object URI after upload if available. Used for user download, audit, and recovery. Null if upload did not complete or failed.

IStoryfieldAiS3UploadHistory.ICreate.description: Request body for creating a new S3 upload history record in the storyfield_ai_s3_upload_histories table. Captures all necessary information to track, diagnose, and audit a media file upload event, ensuring business, compliance, and operational traceability. This entity enables unified tracking for all file uploads performed via the Spring backend, supporting user-level quota enforcement, error investigation, and compliance reviews.

filename.description: (Optional) Updated filename if file was renamed after initial upload. Used for audit and correction scenarios.

file_size.description: (Optional) Updated file size in bytes if the file was replaced or modified. For correcting upload records and audit.

media_type.description: (Optional) Modified media type (e.g., 'tts_audio' updated to 'story_image'). Use with caution under admin control only.

upload_status.description: (Optional) Revised upload status, supporting updates after retry, S3 completion, or administrative review.

error_message.description: (Optional) Supplemented or corrected error context after upload troubleshooting or system event correlation.

spring_upload_url.description: (Optional) Updated Spring backend upload URI after endpoint migration or system change.

s3_object_url.description: (Optional) S3 URI or null if file became inaccessible after error/corrective action.

deleted_at.description: (Optional) Logical deletion timestamp if the upload record is being marked as deleted for compliance, GDPR, or retention policy enforcement.

IStoryfieldAiS3UploadHistory.IUpdate.description: Request body for updating an existing S3 upload history record. Permits correction of upload metadata, audit fields, and logical deletion time for compliance and operational needs. All fields optional and modifications are subject to admin-level validation. Only valid updates are reflected in system history.

api_type.description: (Optional) Filter by external API type (e.g., 'openai', 's3', 'spring_backend', 'asr', 'tts'). Used to target failures with particular providers.

endpoint.description: (Optional) Filter by the external API endpoint or path that failed. Supports fine-grained troubleshooting.

http_method.description: (Optional) The HTTP method used on the failed request (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, etc.). Used for further narrowing of incident impact.

error_code.description: (Optional) API or HTTP error code. Used for searching for recurring systemic issues.

retry_count.description: (Optional) Number of retries attempted for this operation. Allows filtering by incidents requiring repeated recovery.

storyfield_ai_authenticateduser_id.description: (Optional) Filter events for a specific authenticated user by user ID reference. Supports user-centric incident response.

storyfield_ai_story_id.description: (Optional) Filter by incidents affecting a particular story (UUID). Supports resource-specific monitoring and debugging.

created_from.description: (Optional) Earliest timestamp for incident search window (inclusive). Allows timespan-based analysis.

created_to.description: (Optional) Latest timestamp for incident search window (inclusive). Used for time-boxed reviews, dashboards, audit sampling.

page.description: (Optional) Page number for paginated retrieval as per standard business API conventions.

limit.description: (Optional) Maximum number of results per page for pagination, supporting business UI and analytics scale requirements.

IStoryfieldAiExternalApiFailure.IRequest.description: Advanced filter/search parameters for querying external API failure logs. Enables fine-grained incident review, root-cause analysis, platform monitoring, and dashboard production on the storyfield_ai_external_api_failures table. Used almost exclusively by system admins or business analysts for targeted troubleshooting and operational analytics. All fields optional and combinable.

id.description: Unique identifier for the API failure record. Used for referencing, troubleshooting, and audit workflows.

storyfield_ai_authenticateduser_id.description: (Optional) User involved (if known) in the failed API request, links to storyfield_ai_authenticatedusers.id. Used for user-impact assessment.

storyfield_ai_story_id.description: (Optional) Story resource involved (if any) in the API failure event, links to storyfield_ai_stories.id. Enables targeted incident review and compliance reporting.

api_type.description: Type of external API (e.g., 'openai', 'asr', 'tts', 'spring_backend', 's3', 'payment') where the failure was detected. Used for incident categorization, provider reporting, and operational SLA tracking.

endpoint.description: API endpoint, resource path, or URL that triggered the failure. Enables precise failure traceback and time-aligned incident diagnosis.

http_method.description: HTTP request method used during the failure event (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, etc.). Critical for troubleshooting request semantics and debugging third-party integration logic.

error_code.description: Error code received from the target API (status, business code, exception ID, etc.). Used for root-cause investigation, pattern recognition, and operational reporting.

error_message.description: The text details or exception returned by the failed API. Used for business-aware error messaging, incident audits, and forensics. May include raw provider errors for troubleshooting.

request_payload.description: (Optional) Exact JSON or form data submitted to the API at the time of the failed request. Used for deep forensic review but may be limited/masked by business and GDPR policies.

response_payload.description: (Optional) API's raw HTTP response body (e.g., error body, diagnostics) as returned from provider. Business, security, and privacy policy may restrict actual storage and output for compliance. Null if unavailable or forbidden by data policies.

retry_count.description: Number of retry attempts performed for the given failed API invocation, including the initial attempt. Supports operational SLA analysis, problem management, and debugging.

session_id.description: (Optional) Correlation or session ID for operation traceability across distributed system boundaries.

created_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the failure event was recorded. Used for chronological sorting, incident timelines, and SLA breaches.

updated_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the record was last updated, for audit and multi-step recovery analysis.

deleted_at.description: (Optional) Logical deletion timestamp for this failure record if removed for compliance, GDPR, or audit window expiry. Null if record remains active.

IStoryfieldAiExternalApiFailure.description: Detailed schema for an external API failure log, as persisted in storyfield_ai_external_api_failures table. Captures all forensic, operational, compliance, and audit-related fields required for incident response, business analytics, and regulatory review. All relevant links to user and story are optional and can be null if not applicable. Data is recorded and timestamped to ensure perfect festival and legal traceability, and may be filtered to safeguard against GDPR or internal privacy requirements. Supports comprehensive system health monitoring, root cause analysis, and integration partner reviews.

policy_code.description: The unique code identifier for a system policy. Used to filter or search for a specific policy.

name.description: The human-readable name of the policy. Can be used for search and filter operations.

type.description: The data type of the policy value. For example, 'boolean', 'int', 'json', etc. Used as a filter criteria.

active.description: Whether to filter by active (true) or inactive (false) policies.

page.description: The page number to retrieve for paginated query results. Must be 1 or greater.

limit.description: The number of records per page for pagination. Must be between 1 and 200.

created_from.description: Filter results to policies created at or after this ISO 8601 timestamp.

created_to.description: Filter results to policies created before or at this ISO 8601 timestamp.

IStoryfieldAiSystemPolicy.IRequest.description: Request parameters for filtering, searching, and paginating system policy records. Enables flexible admin queries by code, name, type, and status.

id.description: Unique identifier for the system policy record.

policy_code.description: Unique string code representing the policy for programmatic reference by subsystems.

name.description: Human-friendly policy name for documentation and admin UI.

description.description: Full description of the policy's business intent, operational effect, or compliance requirements.

value.description: Current value of the policy, can be a string, boolean (serialized), JSON, or other scalar.

type.description: Underlying data type of the policy value (e.g., 'boolean', 'int', 'duration', 'json').

active.description: Whether this policy is currently enforced (true = in effect, false = not enforced).

created_at.description: Datetime when the policy was first created.

updated_at.description: Datetime when the policy was last updated (modification or enforcement changes).

deleted_at.description: When the policy was soft-deleted, for audit/compliance. Null if not deleted.

IStoryfieldAiSystemPolicy.description: A record representing a single global business or technical policy in the StoryField AI platform. Policies control operational, compliance, or feature toggle rules and are tracked for audit and admin management.

policy_code.description: Unique code for the policy, used as a programmatic schema key.

name.description: Admin-facing human name for the policy.

description.description: Detailed description of the policy meaning, scope, and business effect.

value.description: The value for the policy. May be a string, serialized boolean, JSON, etc., depending on policy type.

type.description: The type of value, such as 'boolean', 'int', 'json', etc.

active.description: If true, this policy is enforced at runtime; otherwise, it is ignored.

IStoryfieldAiSystemPolicy.ICreate.description: Payload for creating a new system-level business or technical policy. All fields required and must pass validation/uniqueness.

policy_code.description: Update the code for the policy. Must remain unique if changed.

name.description: Update the admin-friendly name of the policy.

description.description: Update the policy's detailed business or compliance description.

value.description: New value for the policy, in a format consistent with its type.

type.description: Change the data type ('boolean', 'int', etc.) for the policy.

active.description: Set the enforcement status (active or disabled) for this policy.

deleted_at.description: Optional: Soft-delete or restore the policy by setting or unsetting this property.

IStoryfieldAiSystemPolicy.IUpdate.description: Payload for updating one or more fields of an existing system policy record. Any subset of fields may be provided; partial updates allowed.

env_key.description: Configuration key to filter environment settings (e.g., OPENAI_API_KEY).

env_name.description: The environment label to filter on (e.g., 'local', 'development', 'staging', 'production').

changed_by.description: The actor/administrator who last changed the setting.

change_reason.description: Description or reason for the latest change (for audit traceability).

page.description: Pagination: page number (1-based).

limit.description: Pagination: number of records per page.

IStoryfieldAiEnvSetting.IRequest.description: Request type for searching, filtering, and paginating environment variable settings records for business audits or administrative review. Supports advanced query on env_key, env_name, actor, reason, and temporal ranges, as outlined in compliance documentation and business requirements. Pagination and sorting enable scalable, efficient lookups.

id.description: Unique identifier for this environment variable setting entry. Used as the primary key in the system.

env_key.description: The environment variable's key string (e.g., 'OPENAI_API_KEY'), referencing the name of the variable used by system runtime.

env_value.description: Configuration value for the environment variable. May be an API key, endpoint, or setting. Sensitive values should be masked as appropriate in UIs.

env_name.description: Name of the environment for this configuration (e.g., 'local', 'development', 'staging', 'production'). Enables separated values for different system run modes.

changed_by.description: Identifier of the user, admin, or service account that changed this setting.

change_reason.description: A narrative reason or description for why this configuration was created; important for compliance and troubleshooting.

created_at.description: ISO8601 timestamp when the configuration was created in the database. Used for traceability and audit trail.

updated_at.description: ISO8601 timestamp for when this setting was last modified.

deleted_at.description: Timestamp (ISO 8601) when this setting was soft deleted. Null if active.

IStoryfieldAiEnvSettings.description: Represents a single environment variable setting, as persisted in the storyfield_ai_env_settings table. Includes metadata for configuration management, audit tracking, and compliance (actor, reason, timestamps, deletion state). Used in administration and compliance enforcement workflows.

env_value.description: The value to set for this variable (can be any string; secrets should be handled securely).

changed_by.description: The actor/administrator defining or rotating this environment setting (for trace/audit).

change_reason.description: Explanation or comment for why the new environment setting is being defined or updated (important for configuration governance).

IStoryfieldAiEnvSettings.ICreate.description: Type for creating a new environment variable setting, as accepted on environment setting creation endpoints. All fields are required for traceable audit records. Follow all business documentation and compliance guidance for secret and configuration entry lifecycles. Value may be sensitive; ensure confidentiality via system and UI policy. Corresponds to business rules in deployment/ops documentation.

env_key.description: The environment variable's key (ONLY if updating the key name; generally discouraged except for key migration scenarios).

env_value.description: New value for the configuration entry; may represent secret rotation or endpoint update. Observe sensitive value handling restrictions.

env_name.description: Environment label or scope for which this variable applies. Can only be changed during environment migration or correction; use with caution.

changed_by.description: Identifier for the administrator or process performing the update (full audit trace for compliance).

change_reason.description: Update reason or business context for the configuration change (supports audit and governance best practices).

IStoryfieldAiEnvSettings.IUpdate.description:
Type for updating an existing environment variable setting entry (partial update allowed). Used in administrative workflows for secret rotation, environment migration, or correction of audit metadata. Mutable fields comply with all audit requirements and business rules in configuration management.

Follow compliance policy for what may or may not be changed, and always track change_reason and changed_by when updating values. NEVER include properties not defined by the schema.

deploymentLabel.description: Label identifying the deployment or rollback event. Used for filtering logs by label, such as semantic version (e.g., 'v1.10.7').

actionType.description: Type of deployment action (e.g., 'deploy', 'rollback', 'hotfix', 'config-change'). Used for filtering.

environment.description: Target deployment environment (e.g., 'production', 'staging', 'development').

initiatedBy.description: Identifier (admin, CI user, scriptID) representing who initiated the deployment action.

summary.description: Free-form textual summary or search keywords for the deployment event.

createdAtFrom.description: Start (inclusive) of created_at filtering range (ISO8601 date-time).

createdAtTo.description: End (inclusive) of created_at filtering range (ISO8601 date-time).

page.description: Page number for pagination.

limit.description: Number of records per page.

IStoryfieldAiDeploymentLog.IRequest.description: Request body for searching deployment log records in the system. Supports filtering by deployment label, action type, environment, initiator, status, summary, and creation timestamps. Pagination is controlled by page and limit.

id.description: Unique identifier for this deployment log record. Used for update and detail queries.

deploymentLabel.description: Label identifying the deployment or rollback event. For example, semantic version (e.g., 'v1.10.7'), tag, or custom label.

environment.description: Target environment for this deployment event (e.g., 'production', 'staging', 'development').

initiatedBy.description: Identifier of the actor who initiated the deployment (admin handle, CI/CD user, or scriptID).

summary.description: Free-form textual summary of this deployment event.

createdAt.description: Datetime when deployment or rollback started (ISO8601).

deletedAt.description: Soft delete timestamp if this deployment log is logically deleted (ISO8601). Null if not deleted.

IStoryfieldAiDeploymentLog.description: Represents a deployment, rollback, or hotfix event log in the system. Captures deployment label, action type, target environment, initiator, status, summary, audit timestamps, and soft delete marker for system operations, audit traceability, and compliance tracking.

deploymentLabel.description: Label for the new deployment or rollback event (e.g., semantic version, tag, or descriptive label). Required.

environment.description: Target environment for this deployment (e.g., 'production', 'staging', 'development'). Required.

initiatedBy.description: Identifier of the actor who initiated this deployment (admin handle, CI/CD user, or scriptID). Required.

status.description: Outcome status for the new deployment (e.g., 'success', 'failed', 'in-progress', 'aborted'). Required.

summary.description: Summary of the deployment, hotfix, or rollback action. Required.

IStoryfieldAiDeploymentLog.ICreate.description: Request structure for creating a new deployment log record. Only core, required fields are included as the new log's content.

deploymentLabel.description: New label value for the deployment log, if being revised.

actionType.description: New action type value, if being revised.

environment.description: New target environment value, if being revised.

initiatedBy.description: New initiator value, if being revised.

status.description: New outcome status value, if being revised.

summary.description: New summary field value, if being revised.

updatedAt.description: Datetime of last modification for this deployment log (ISO8601).

deletedAt.description: Soft delete timestamp for logical removal, or null to restore.

IStoryfieldAiDeploymentLog.IUpdate.description: Payload for updating an existing deployment log record. Fields are all optional and subject to business logic for events, status, and correction. The updatedAt field should be used to record the modification time. The deletedAt field allows marking as deleted or restoring.

alert_type.description: Categorical alert/event type, e.g., 'error', 'warning', 'info'. Used for filtering queries.

alert_code.description: Structured alert code. Example: AUTH_401_012. Used for filtering and business search.

environment.description: Target environment for filtering; e.g. 'production', 'staging', 'development'.

resolved.description: If provided, filters by currently resolved (closed) or open alert state.

created_at_from.description: Lower bound on creation timestamp for alert filtering.

created_at_to.description: Upper bound on creation timestamp for alert filtering.

search.description: Free-text keyword search on content, code, etc.

page.description: Page number for pagination.

limit.description: Page size for pagination. Maximum is 100.

IStoryfieldAiServiceAlert.IRequest.description: Search, filter, and pagination parameters for Storyfield AI service alerts.

id.description: Unique identifier for the service alert record.

alert_type.description: Categorical alert/event type (e.g., 'error', 'warning', 'info', 'quota', 'incident', 'recovery'), classified per service alert taxonomy.

alert_code.description: Structured business or technical alert code. May represent error class, status, policy violation, etc. Example: AUTH_401_012.

content.description: Detailed description of the alert event or system condition. Multi-paragraph text permitted. Should avoid embedding any personal data.

environment.description: Named environment for which this alert applies; typically one of: 'production', 'staging', 'development', etc.

resolved.description: Whether this alert/event has been acknowledged/resolved (true) or is currently open/active (false).

oneOf.description: Human-facing note or summary explaining how/when/why the alert was resolved. May be omitted/null until resolved.

resolution_note.description: Resolution note or closure details. Present when alert is resolved, otherwise null.

created_at.description: Timestamp when alert/event was recorded, in ISO 8601 date-time format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp of last update (e.g., resolution, escalation).

deleted_at.description: Soft delete timestamp for logical removal. Null if still active/visible.

IStoryfieldAiServiceAlert.description:
Service-wide event alert record in the Storyfield AI platform. Contains detailed incident/health/notification data for monitoring, business logic, and compliance.

This schema directly represents rows from the `storyfield_ai_service_alerts` table. Each alert describes a technical, operational, or business status, error, or signal requiring attention. All fields are documented for compliance and are suitable both for UI monitoring and audit review. Sensitive data such as personal user details must never be included in any alert content or code.

alert_code.description: Structured code for this alert for precise business or technical classification. Example: AUTH_401_012.

content.description: Full text of the alert, suitable for admin dashboard and incident log. May be multi-line.

environment.description: Name of the target service environment (e.g., 'production', 'staging', 'development').

resolution_note.description: Optionally provide a summary or resolution status at registration. Usually left null unless registering a closed alert at once.

IStoryfieldAiServiceAlert.ICreate.description:
Creation body for a new service alert. Used by system admins and automated incident bots for registering new events.

All required properties must be provided. This type does not include auto-generated metadata (id/timestamps), which are assigned upon actual record creation. The `resolution_note` is optional and can be provided at creation or set to null.

alert_type.description: If present, updates the alert event type (e.g., upon escalation or reclassification).

alert_code.description: If present, updates the business or technical alert code.

content.description: Optional new/modified content for the alert.

environment.description: Optionally change the environment tag for reclassification.

resolved.description: Mark alert as resolved or re-opened. Admins set to true to close/acknowledge.

resolution_note.description: Optional note for how/why the alert was resolved/closed.

IStoryfieldAiServiceAlert.IUpdate.description:
Patch/update type for existing alert records. Used by system administrators to adjust, resolve, or clarify alert details over lifecycle.

All properties are optional. Only specified fields will be changed. Fields omitted are left as-is. This type does not include auto-generated id/timestamps.

id.description: Unique identifier of the authenticated user, as the primary key in the `storyfield_ai_authenticatedusers` table. Used for strict identity, relationship mapping, and compliance tracking. Follows standard UUID format.

external_user_id.description: External user ID issued by the Spring backend. This field is unique for every authenticated user, serves as a reference to the external identity provider, and ensures seamless user mapping across integrated systems.

email.description: Unique email address of the authenticated user. Must match the registration used with the Spring backend. The system enforces uniqueness for this email, providing identity assurance and regulatory audit traceability.

actor_type.description: Business role for this actor; always 'authenticatedUser' for entries in this table. Used for permission matrix and authorization enforcement throughout the StoryField AI service.

created_at.description: Timestamp for when this user was initially created in the system. Key for audit trail, onboarding traceability, and compliance requirements.

updated_at.description: Timestamp of the last update to this user record. Used for modification and lifecycle tracking in compliance with business and regulatory policies.

IStoryfieldAiAuthenticatedUser.ISummary.description:
Summary Data Transfer Object (DTO) for the `storyfield_ai_authenticatedusers` entity. 

Provides a concise view of key identity and audit attributes for an authenticated user within the StoryField AI platform. This summary type is used for list views, search results, and admin dashboards. 

Includes primary system-assigned identifiers, external references to the authentication provider, business role context, and audit-relevant timestamps. Sensitive fields are excluded to ensure privacy and compliance.

id.description: Globally unique primary key for the system administrator record. Used for secure entity management, relationship tracking, and compliance audits.

external_admin_id.description: External admin ID, mapped from the Spring/JWT backend. Required to uniquely identify administrators for login, session management, and traceability.

email.description: Administrator email address, unique per admin. Used for authentication, policy escalation, and contact purposes. Enforced unique at the database level.

actor_type.description: Fixed actor role for system admin accounts; always set to 'systemAdmin'. Used in the platform's permission matrices and business logic validation.

last_login_at.description: Datetime for the last successful login of the admin. Used for activity tracking, privilege review, and compliance. Null if never logged in.

created_at.description: Timestamp when this admin account was created, supporting historical audit and onboarding tracking.

updated_at.description: Timestamp of the most recent update to this admin record. Essential for modification traceability and compliance review.

deleted_at.description: Timestamp for soft deletion/logical removal of the admin record. Null if the account is still active. Used for compliance, deactivation, or emergency response scenarios.

IStoryfieldAiSystemAdmin.ISummary.description:
Summary Data Transfer Object (DTO) for the `storyfield_ai_systemadmins` entity.

Provides an overview of essential system administrator identity and audit fields for the StoryField AI platform. Used in administrative user lists, access review modules, and compliance dashboards.

Captures all unique identification/relationship fields, business-role context, and audit timestamps. Includes soft deletion fields for account lifecycle management. Sensitive access and session information is intentionally omitted from this summary type.

id.description: Primary key, UUIDv4, for the storyfield_ai_stories record. Used for business logic, data modeling, and audit mapping.

storyfield_ai_authenticateduser_id.description: Foreign key reference to the owning authenticated user. Used for strict ownership enforcement, privacy, and compliance mapping. Links directly to `storyfield_ai_authenticatedusers.id`.

title.description: Title for the AI-generated fairy tale, either provided by the user or generated by the system. Used for display, search, and story retrieval operations.

language.description: Primary language or dialect in which the story was generated. Used for accessibility, content filtering, and linguistic analytics.

created_at.description: Creation timestamp for when the story entity was first established. Required for business audits, event ordering, and regulatory compliance.

updated_at.description: Time of last modification to the story entity. Collected for audit trails, compliance, and UI freshness indicators.

deleted_at.description: Soft delete timestamp (null if not deleted). Used for data lifecycle management, moderation, and GDPR compliance. When set, the story is inactive but retained for audit purposes.

IStoryfieldAiStory.ISummary.description:
Summary Data Transfer Object (DTO) for the `storyfield_ai_stories` (AI-generated Fairy Tale) entity.

Presents a lightweight view for list/search operations, summarizing key ownership, metadata, and audit fields. Enables indexed search, ownership verification, and presentation in brief views.

Sensitive or large-content fields (e.g., main plot, full pages) are excluded to preserve privacy and improve retrieval efficiency. Includes creation/update/delete audit fields for lifecycle transparency at a summary level.

id.description: Primary key, UUIDv4, for the storyfield_ai_story_images entity. Uniquely identifies each illustration generated or uploaded per story, for retrieval, updating, or display.

storyfield_ai_story_id.description: Foreign key reference to the parent story. Used for ownership and relationship mapping between the image and the associated fairy tale.

image_uri.description: URI (commonly an S3 pre-signed URL or public URL) pointing to the stored image. Required for media download, display, and programmatic integration.

description.description: Optional alt text or image description for accessibility compliance and searchability. May be null if omitted.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the image record was created, for tracking chronology and audit purposes.

updated_at.description: Timestamp of the most recent update to the image record. Used for compliance and UI cache invalidation logic.

deleted_at.description: Soft deletion flag: datetime if logically deleted, null if active. Used for privacy, regulatory compliance, or moderation workflow.

IStoryfieldAiStoryImage.ISummary.description:
Summary Data Transfer Object (DTO) for the `storyfield_ai_story_images` (Story Image) entity.

Provides a concise, performance-optimized record layout for use in list, gallery, or administrative moderation implementations. Combines identification, core relationship, and minimal metadata fields. 

Omitting large binary fields ensures that lists and search responses return efficiently while including audit trail and access-control metadata. Sensitive or unpublished images are not directly exposed in summary views.

IStoryfieldAiTokenSession.ISummary.description:
A summary object representing an authentication token/session for display in paginated lists or audit tables. Includes only essential metadata for quick lookup or moderation panel. Used in administrative dashboards and user session tracking views. Does NOT include sensitive fields such as token values; only identification, timing, and ownership data.

Based on `storyfield_ai_token_sessions` entity. For more detail, refer to the full token session object definition.

id.description: Unique identifier of the token/session record (UUID, primary key).

authenticated_user_id.description: Reference (UUID) to the authenticated user this session belongs to, or null if this is an admin/system-only session.

system_admin_id.description: Reference (UUID) to the system admin for this session, if applicable.

issued_at.description: Date and time the token/session was issued (ISO 8601 timestamp, UTC).

expires_at.description: Expiration deadline for this session/token (ISO 8601 timestamp, UTC).

refreshed_at.description: Most recent refresh timestamp for this session (ISO 8601, nullable).

last_activity_at.description: Timestamp of last activity (token check) in the current session (ISO 8601, UTC).

fingerprint.description: Device or browser fingerprint used to ensure session uniqueness per client, for security audit.

deleted_at.description: Soft-deletion timestamp, or null if still active (ISO 8601, UTC).

IStoryfieldAiTokenRevocation.ISummary.description:
A summary object for a token revocation event. Used in lists of revoked tokens and security dashboards. Includes minimum identifying/trace fieldsâ€”never the actual revoked token value.

Follows the `storyfield_ai_token_revocations` schema and is designed for admin audit, incident response, and compliance views. Only business- and audit-relevant fields are included for performance and privacy.

id.description: Unique identifier of the revocation record.

token_hash.description: Hash of the revoked authentication token (never the actual raw token).

revoked_reason.description: Administrative or automated reason for why the token was revoked (e.g. manual logout, abuse, expire, compromise).

created_at.description: The time the revocation record was created (ISO 8601).

token_session_id.description: Optionally, the session this revocation refers to (nullable UUID, for orphaned/scan revocations).

authenticated_user_id.description: Authenticated user this revocation refers to (nullable UUID; absent for system/integration tokens).

system_admin_id.description: System admin user for the revocation, if applicable.

IStoryfieldAiAuthAuditLog.ISummary.description:
Compact representation of an authentication/authorization audit event for audit dashboards, search results, and incident investigation lists. Contains minimal fields linking event to actor/session type and timestamp. Detailed context available only in the full log object; summary is optimized for volume and search performance.

Based on `storyfield_ai_auth_audit_logs` entity. Includes type/outcome, actor links, session, and event time.

id.description: Unique identifier of this audit log entry (UUID).

event_type.description: Type of authentication or authorization event. Examples: 'issued', 'validated', 'revoked', 'failure', etc.

authenticated_user_id.description: UUID of the authenticated user linked to this audit log, if applicable (nullable).

system_admin_id.description: UUID of the system admin linked to this audit log, if applicable.

token_session_id.description: Token/session UUID (nullable) to which this event applies.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the event was recorded (ISO 8601, UTC).

IStoryfieldAiIntegrationLog.ISummary.description:
Compact summary view of a system integration log event, suitable for tabular display and search in admin dashboards. Focuses on cross-system action context, outcomes, and entity relationships by UUID.

Draws from `storyfield_ai_integration_logs` schema. Used for admin review, operational monitoring, and compliance report summaries.

id.description: Unique identifier for this integration log entry (UUID).

event_type.description: Business event type (e.g. API_CALL, ERROR, RECOVERY).

subsystem.description: Subsystem or connector name involved in this event (e.g., spring_backend, openai, s3, etc.).

status.description: Outcome status of the integration event (SUCCESS, FAILURE, PARTIAL, etc.).

created_at.description: Timestamp event was created in the database (ISO 8601, UTC).

storyfield_ai_authenticateduser_id.description: Optional reference to the user associated with this event (nullable UUID).

storyfield_ai_story_id.description: Optional reference to the story associated with the integration log (nullable UUID).

IStoryfieldAiS3UploadHistory.ISummary.description:
Summary of an S3 upload history event, representing a single file upload to external storage (typically S3) via the Spring backend. Includes identifying fields, audit/trace fields, and result metadata.

Used for list views, operational dashboards, and compliance audit overviews. Does not store full payloads, just reference, outcome, and linkage data. Referenced to troubleshoot or investigate upload issues involving users or system events.

Fields:
- id: Unique UUID of the upload history event (primary key; references 'storyfield_ai_s3_upload_histories.id').
- storyfield_ai_authenticateduser_id: Optional UUID of user who initiated the upload (foreign key; can be null for admin/system uploads).
- storyfield_ai_story_id: Optional UUID for the related story (foreign key; can be null if upload not tied to a story).
- filename: Upload file name as persisted/audited.
- file_size: File size in bytes at upload.
- media_type: String code indicating uploaded resource type (e.g., 'story_image', 'tts_audio').
- upload_status: Upload outcome, such as 'SUCCESS', 'FAILURE', 'RETRY'.
- error_message: Optional description for failure or diagnostic (can be null if upload succeeded).
- spring_upload_url: Full Spring API endpoint used for upload reference (not S3 url).
- s3_object_url: S3 object URL if upload successful (null if upload failed or incomplete).
- created_at: ISO 8601 datetime of history creation (tracked at upload start time).
- updated_at: ISO 8601 datetime of last update to this record.
- deleted_at: If soft-deleted (compliance/hard delete), timestamp; else null (active).

id.description: Unique UUID identifier for this upload history event.

oneOf.description: Identifier of authenticated user who initiated the upload, or null if admin/system upload.

storyfield_ai_authenticateduser_id.description: Identifier of authenticated user who initiated the upload, or null if admin/system upload.

oneOf.description: Identifier of linked story (if present), or null if not linked.

storyfield_ai_story_id.description: Identifier of linked story (if present), or null if not linked.

filename.description: File name of the uploaded resource as registered at upload time.

file_size.description: Size of uploaded file in bytes.

media_type.description: String code for upload resource type (e.g. 'story_image', 'tts_audio').

upload_status.description: Upload result status, such as 'SUCCESS', 'FAILURE', 'RETRY', etc.

oneOf.description: Description or error message if upload failed.

error_message.description: Description or error message if upload failed.

spring_upload_url.description: The Spring backend API endpoint used for uploading the file (not an S3 URL).

oneOf.description: The resulting S3 object URL if upload succeeded, or null if unavailable.

s3_object_url.description: The resulting S3 object URL if upload succeeded, or null if unavailable.

created_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the history record was created (upload started).

updated_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of last record update.

oneOf.description: Timestamp of deletion if soft deleted (compliance), else null if active.

deleted_at.description: Timestamp of deletion if soft deleted (compliance), else null if active.

IStoryfieldAiEnvSetting.description:
Detailed system environment or secret setting/configuration record, as registered in the system-wide environment audit table. Captures key-value pairs for critical deployment/config management, with complete audit and change tracking. Supports compliance monitoring, audits, and config management.

Fields:
- id: UUID of the environment setting (primary key; references 'storyfield_ai_env_settings.id').
- env_key: Unique key name for the configuration item or secret (e.g. 'OPENAI_API_KEY').
- env_value: Current value for this variable (may be masked for output); string.
- env_name: Environment tag (e.g. 'development', 'production', 'staging').
- changed_by: Who last updated the variable (email or admin account name).
- change_reason: Reason for last change (must be filled for compliance/audit).
- created_at: ISO 8601 timestamp when this setting record was created.
- updated_at: ISO 8601 timestamp when last changed.
- deleted_at: Soft delete timestamp if this variable is retired, else null (active).

id.description: Unique identifier for this environment setting record.

env_key.description: Key name for the configuration item or secret (unique within an environment).

env_value.description: Value for this config/secret (as a string, possibly masked for secret fields).

env_name.description: Environment context for this variable (e.g. 'production', 'staging', 'development', etc.).

changed_by.description: Identity (email/account) of the actor who last changed this record.

change_reason.description: Change reason (required for audit trail and rollback support).

created_at.description: Record creation timestamp (ISO 8601 format).

updated_at.description: Datetime variable was last updated (ISO 8601).

oneOf.description: Timestamp if soft deleted, else null if currently active.

deleted_at.description: Timestamp if soft deleted, else null if currently active.

IStoryfieldAiDeploymentLog.ISummary.description:
Summary view of a deployment, rollback, or hotfix event as recorded in the system deployment log table. Used for list display, operational audit dashboards, and compliance reporting. Represents each unique deployment-related lifecycle event with a concise field subset.

Fields:
- id: Unique event record identity (UUID, references 'storyfield_ai_deployment_logs.id').
- deployment_label: Human-readable label or tag for this deployment or release.
- action_type: Describes type of event, e.g. 'deploy', 'rollback', 'hotfix', 'config-change'.
- environment: Target environment for this release/action (e.g. 'production', 'staging').
- initiated_by: Who initiated the deployment (user/email/CICD bot).
- status: Result status of deployment event (e.g. 'success', 'in-progress', 'failed', 'aborted').
- summary: Brief description of what was delivered/changed/patched during event.
- created_at: ISO 8601 deployment event time.
- updated_at: ISO 8601 last update for this record.
- deleted_at: If record is hard-deleted, timestamp value; else null (active or in audit log only).

id.description: Unique deployment event record identity.

action_type.description: Canonical event string describing type, e.g. 'deploy', 'rollback', 'hotfix', 'config-change'.

environment.description: Environment for this deployment event (e.g. 'production', 'staging', 'development').

status.description: Event outcome: 'success', 'in-progress', 'aborted', etc. (as stored in schema/table).

summary.description: Short description of what was released, rolled back, or changed.

created_at.description: ISO 8601 creation timestamp.

updated_at.description: ISO 8601 last update timestamp.

oneOf.description: Timestamp of deletion if record removed; else null.

deleted_at.description: Timestamp of deletion if record removed; else null.

IStoryfieldAiServiceAlert.ISummary.description:
Summary list view of a system service alert event, showing incident/alert type, core metadata, environment context, and resolution status.

This is for monitoring dashboards, incident triage, and bulk operationsâ€”all critical fields and alert state displayed for at-a-glance review.

Fields:
- id: Unique identifier for the alert (UUID, references 'storyfield_ai_service_alerts.id').
- alert_type: Type/category of alert (e.g. 'error', 'warning', 'incident', 'quota', 'info', 'recovery').
- alert_code: Business or system code for alert (may group related incidents).
- content: Textual description/summary for alert, up to system's list presentation character limit.
- environment: Deployment/env in which alert was triggered (e.g. 'production', 'dev').
- resolved: Boolean for whether alert is currently resolved/closed.
- resolution_note: If resolved, content or explanation (nullable); blank for unresolved.
- created_at: ISO 8601 issue time.
- updated_at: ISO 8601 alert update/resolution time.
- deleted_at: Optional timestamp for logical deletion (alert closed/removed), else null if active.

id.description: Unique identifier for this alert record.

alert_type.description: Alert classification type (error, warning, info, incident, etc.).

content.description: Text description or summary for this alert.

environment.description: Target environment of alert ('production', 'dev', etc.).

resolved.description: True if alert is resolved/closed, false if open.

oneOf.description: Textual note for alert resolution (blank/null if not resolved).

resolution_note.description: Textual note for alert resolution (blank/null if not resolved).

created_at.description: Issue time (alert creation, ISO 8601).

updated_at.description: Alert last updated (including resolution).

oneOf.description: Timestamp of logical deletion (if removed/closed); null if alert is active.

deleted_at.description: Timestamp of logical deletion (if removed/closed); null if alert is active.
